author: PaulHigin
body:
These tests have been ported from Windows code base and converted to Pester.
Note that some tests are currently pending because PowerShell Core does not yet support Windows platform application allow APIs.  This is being tracked by issue #4778.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@PaulHigin Some tests look to me should be able to run on Unix platforms, such as the following:
```
Describe "Switch -file in constrained language mode"
Describe "Get content syntax in constrained language mode"
Describe "Stream redirection in constrained language mode"
Describe "Invoke-Expression in constrained language mode"
...
```
But currently, all those tests are made windows only. Is there something prevents them from running on Unix now?

(I didn't go through all conversations in this PR, so sorry that if you already answered a similar question)

title: Port tests for constrained language mode
